GOD.content: [economy of the sacrifice] in turn toward new mystery, toward new structure of responsibility, prior one never eliminated, kept w/in oneself, mourned as crypt of a more ancient secret > is this repression, is this a kind of sacrificial Aufhebung?
GOD.linkedContent: [economy of the sacrifice] in turn toward new mystery, toward new structure of responsibility, prior one never eliminated, kept w/in oneself, mourned as crypt of a more ancient secret > is this repression, is this a kind of sacrificial Aufhebung?

GOD.content: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)
GOD.linkedContent: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)

GOD.content: time of the promise of Christianity defines both experience of mysterium tremendum, and the double repression that institutes it
GOD.linkedContent: time of the promise of Christianity defines both experience of mysterium tremendum, and the double repression that institutes it

GOD.content: via Nietzsche’s “genius of Christianity,” moralizing the mechanisms of debt via moral duty & bad conscience, a hyperbolized repression: sacrificial hubris
GOD.linkedContent: via Nietzsche’s “genius of Christianity,” moralizing the mechanisms of debt via moral duty & bad conscience, a hyperbolized repression: sacrificial hubris

GT.content: be careful, ethically vigilant re: gift w/out debt, there’s calculation & ruse (economy) even in the unconscious
GT.linkedContent: be careful, ethically vigilant re: gift w/out debt, there’s calculation & ruse (economy) even in the unconscious

GT.content: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological
GT.linkedContent: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological

BL.content: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law
BL.linkedContent: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law

AF.content: stakes of conceptual difference btwn Verdrängung and Unterdrückung not only nominal questions of translation, but they are accumulated there
AF.linkedContent: stakes of conceptual difference btwn Verdrängung and Unterdrückung not only nominal questions of translation, but they are accumulated there

AF.content: to not take account of the Freudian impression [resistance], one confirms, countersigns (archives) his theory of “repression”
AF.linkedContent: to not take account of the Freudian impression [resistance], one confirms, countersigns (archives) his theory of “repression”

AF.content: return of the repressed as triumph of life [re: Lou Andreas-Salomé’s reading in Moses], surviving of an excess of life which resists annihilation
AF.linkedContent: return of the repressed as triumph of life [re: Lou Andreas-Salomé’s reading in Moses], surviving of an excess of life which resists annihilation

AF.content: if Yerushalmi believes that archivization & repression [re: killing of Moses] are irreducible, Derrida insists we can archive what we repress, that repression is archivization, that we can  archive otherwise [animals can sign themselves as hidden]
AF.linkedContent: if Yerushalmi believes that archivization & repression [re: killing of Moses] are irreducible, Derrida insists we can archive what we repress, that repression is archivization, that we can archive otherwise [animals can sign themselves as hidden]

AF.content: repression dissimulates or encrypts the archives, archive of the virtual > virtuality removed from its oppositional coupling to actuality, effectivity, reality [re: full & effective actuality of an archived event]
AF.linkedContent: repression dissimulates or encrypts the archives, archive of the virtual > virtuality removed from its oppositional coupling to actuality, effectivity, reality [re: full & effective actuality of an archived event]

POOF.content: for Nietzsche, the lookalike caricatures are the worst enemy of what they resemble, i.e. those w/ “democratic sensibility” > Nietzsche responds in name of hyperbole of democracy to unlock, open, this worst repression
POOF.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, the lookalike caricatures are the worst enemy of what they resemble, i.e. those w/ “democratic sensibility” > Nietzsche responds in name of hyperbole of democracy to unlock, open, this worst repression

PAS.content: forgetting beyond all our categories of forgetting (beyond economy of repressions working toward protection)
PAS.linkedContent: forgetting beyond all our categories of forgetting (beyond economy of repressions working toward protection)

FSW.content: acc. Freud, repression is not forgetting, not exclusion, an interior representation
FSW.linkedContent: acc. Freud, repression is not forgetting, not exclusion, an interior representation

FSW.content: repression of writing, the writing interior to speech contained outside it, repression of that which threatens presence > mastering of absence
FSW.linkedContent: repression of writing, the writing interior to speech contained outside it, repression of that which threatens presence > mastering of absence

FSW.content: “primal repression” contradicts primary process, myth of maintenance > writing is unthinkable w/out repression
FSW.linkedContent: “primal repression” contradicts primary process, myth of maintenance > writing is unthinkable w/out repression

FSW.content: for Freud, erasure of trace, as movement of pure auto-affection, temporalization, makes repression “itself” possible, escapes binarism and makes binarism possible on basis of nothing > useful to deconstruct logocentrism and to exercise at different levels of writing in general
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, erasure of trace, as movement of pure auto-affection, temporalization, makes repression “itself” possible, escapes binarism and makes binarism possible on basis of nothing > useful to deconstruct logocentrism and to exercise at different levels of writing in general

F.content: ghost effect (ghost that comes haunting from someone else’s crypt, heterocryptography) ≠ crypt effect (foreigner incorporated in crypt of Self) > la revenance n’est pas un retour du refoulé ——“ventriloquist” speaks from topography w/in self or from foreign/parental topography
F.linkedContent: ghost effect (ghost that comes haunting from someone else’s crypt, heterocryptography) ≠ crypt effect (foreigner incorporated in crypt of Self) > la revenance n’est pas un retour du refoulé ——“ventriloquist” speaks from topography w/in self or from foreign/parental topography

F.content: very thing that provokes worst suffering must be kept alive, the outpouring of libido at the moment of loss is repressed, not in and of itself, but in relation w/ the dead
F.linkedContent: very thing that provokes worst suffering must be kept alive, the outpouring of libido at the moment of loss is repressed, not in and of itself, but in relation w/ the dead

F.content: “conservative” repression installs in the unconscious what the Self treats as an exquisite corpse, a “surrealism” of folded sentences loses its creases, the paper flattens out, and there is a spot (lieu) of pleasure disguised as pain, which the therapist must exhume
F.linkedContent: “conservative” repression installs in the unconscious what the Self treats as an exquisite corpse, a “surrealism” of folded sentences loses its creases, the paper flattens out, and there is a spot (lieu) of pleasure disguised as pain, which the therapist must exhume

F.content: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”
F.linkedContent: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”

F.content: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu
F.linkedContent: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu

F.content: not hysterical repression, which works via prohibition (not foreign place, nor exclusion)
F.linkedContent: not hysterical repression, which works via prohibition (not foreign place, nor exclusion)

F.content: Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic crypt, doesn’t shelter his own object, but illegitimate object of another [his sister] > if cemetery guard lacks ownership of the tombs, at least he’s entitled to position, Wolf Man is in position of guard as proxy [pp. 199-20n position as guard has been mortgaged, Derrida haunted by this word, this “death pledge”]
F.linkedContent: Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic crypt, doesn’t shelter his own object, but illegitimate object of another [his sister] > if cemetery guard lacks ownership of the tombs, at least he’s entitled to position, Wolf Man is in position of guard as proxy [pp. 199-20n position as guard has been mortgaged, Derrida haunted by this word, this “death pledge”]

FWT.content: Hamlet also machine of repression in politics, spectrality governs problematic of mourning & technics, media, virtual reality > general logic of spectrality
FWT.linkedContent: Hamlet also machine of repression in politics, spectrality governs problematic of mourning & technics, media, virtual reality > general logic of spectrality

POS.content: Houdebine says “no Aufhebung here,” Derrida responds: there is always Aufhebung, just as there is always repression, sublimation, idealization
POS.linkedContent: Houdebine says “no Aufhebung here,” Derrida responds: there is always Aufhebung, just as there is always repression, sublimation, idealization

ROP.content: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & disseminal remaining, no longer belonging to economy of repression
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & disseminal remaining, no longer belonging to economy of repression

ROP.content: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression
ROP.linkedContent: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression

ATIA.content: deconstruction works to open “betrayals of repressed human possibilities,” in the name of another history
ATIA.linkedContent: deconstruction works to open “betrayals of repressed human possibilities,” in the name of another history

LI.content: use of word repressive out of context lacks rigor
LI.linkedContent: use of word repressive out of context lacks rigor

LI.content: always repression in stabilizing determination of a context, repression at origin of meaning, an irreducible violence > can’t say it’s “bad”
LI.linkedContent: always repression in stabilizing determination of a context, repression at origin of meaning, an irreducible violence > can’t say it’s “bad”

AD.content: given Levinas’ idea of paternal fecundity, he’s suspicious of psychoanalysis’ primal repression (for Levinas, it must be secondary)
AD.linkedContent: given Levinas’ idea of paternal fecundity, he’s suspicious of psychoanalysis’ primal repression (for Levinas, it must be secondary)

OG.content: forgetting & repression inadequate ideas to explain finitude & dissimulation > forgetting & repression both products of a philosophy (of meaning)
OG.linkedContent: forgetting & repression inadequate ideas to explain finitude & dissimulation > forgetting & repression both products of a philosophy (of meaning)

EU.content: Freud hasty to call repression psychological “censorship”

SPEC.content: the principle of the functioning of principles, which can only differentiate itself: this structure w/ one term or three-in-one-terms [reality, pleasure, differance] can be exposed w/out calling upon Repression
SPEC.linkedContent: the principle of the functioning of principles, which can only differentiate itself: this structure w/ one term or three-in-one-terms [reality, pleasure, differance] can be exposed w/out calling upon Repression

SPEC.content: is Repression necessary? objective science can’t think qualitative or “subjective” affect, philosophy as phenomenological only thinks presence, psychoanalysis’ concept of Repression permits pleasure to be lived & perceived as unpleasure > but still, is Repression necessary?
SPEC.linkedContent: is Repression necessary? objective science can’t think qualitative or “subjective” affect, philosophy as phenomenological only thinks presence, psychoanalysis’ concept of Repression permits pleasure to be lived & perceived as unpleasure > but still, is Repression necessary?

SPEC.content: Repression upsets logic implicit in all philosophy, pleasure that can’t be felt as such > “cannot be experienced as such”
SPEC.linkedContent: Repression upsets logic implicit in all philosophy, pleasure that can’t be felt as such > “cannot be experienced as such”
